revised_title: A Study of Multiple Births and Fertility
tldr: This article presents a case study of a woman who gave birth to five children at once, with all of them being females. The author discusses the rarity of such events and provides a brief overview of the history of multiple births, including the frequency of twins, triplets, and other multiple births in various countries. The author also examines the factors that may influence fertility and the number of children born at once.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Human Reproduction
